author: Special Correspondent
text:
DMK treasurer M.K. Stalin on Saturday sent a legal notice to MDMK general secretary Vaiko demanding an unconditional apology for making a defamatory statement linking him with Shahid Balwa, the Mumbai-based businessman who was arrested in connection with the 2G spectrum scam.

The legal notice said Mr. Vaiko’s statement had damaged the reputation of Mr. Stalin in the eyes of general public and the DMK cadres who held him in high esteem.

‘Defamatory statement’

“Mr. Stalin had received phone calls and personal visits from persons who had inquired about the defamatory statement which was published in newspapers. It has caused mental agony and bad reputation,” said the notice sent by advocates R. Neelakandan and R. Vivekananthan. Mr. Stalin threatened to initiate civil and criminal proceedings against Mr. Vaiko if he failed to tender an apology in three days.
title: Vaiko gets another legal notice on 2G barb
